Show HN: Steadykey â€“ Deterministic Idempotency Keys with Pluggable Stores
articles.description:
I built Steadykey after fighting duplicate API calls and messy idempotency logic in our queue workers. It canonicalizes any JSON payload (order-insensitive, handles Maps/Sets/BigInts) and hashes it to a stable key, then lets you drop markers into Redis, Postgres, MySQL, MongoDB, SQLite, or an in-memory adapter. You can opt in to storing the canonical payload, refresh TTLs, or clear markers when a workflow finishes. Iâ€™d love feedback on the hashing semantics, adapter API, and any gaps in the docs/examplesâ€”especially if youâ€™ve rolled your own idempotency layer before.

Comments URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=45869400

Points: 1

# Comments: 0

articles.title: Ask HN: Anything to be done with lost Time Machine backup password?
articles.description:
My wife's macbook air was destroyed due to a watery-incident, and it turns out that the Time Machine password isn't anything that we can think of.

The computer was sent off to Apple for applecare+ repair, but when we got it back, the key is no longer in Keychain Access. It's gone.

Some of my students are cybersecurity majors, and they're doing a "class project" trying to crack in during downtime on our university's super computer.

Outside of just being bummed at losing 2 years of content, is there anything to be done that I haven't thought of?

Many thanks!

Comments URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=45869395

Points: 1

# Comments: 0
